thread.title: Woman 'paid £70 to kill half-brother of Kim Jong Un believed it was a TV prank'
thread.title_full: Woman 'paid £70 to kill half-brother of Kim Jong Un believed it was a TV prank'

author: Saphora Smith
title: Woman 'paid £70 to kill half-brother of Kim Jong Un believed it was a TV prank'
text:
Trump vows to build border wall 'soon - way ahead of schedule' 
A woman suspected of killing the half-brother of Kim Jong Un has claimed she was paid £70 to participate in what she thought was a prank TV show, Indonesian authorities have said. 
Siti Aishah, an Indonesian national, told officials she was approached by someone who paid her 400 Malaysian ringgit, the equivalent of £70, to smear what she thought was “oil” on Kim Jong Nam’s face. 
Indonesian deputy ambassador Andreano Erwin said: “She only said in general that somebody asked her to do this activity...She said she was given a kind of oil, like baby oil.” 
He said no charges have yet been brought against her. 
Mr Kim, who is the eldest son of late former North Korean leader Kim Jong-il, was attacked at the busy Kuala Lumpur International Airport on February 13 when trying to board a plane to Macau. Kim Jong Nam has reportedly been assassinated 
CCTV footage, reportedly from the airport, appears to show two women approach Mr Kim from behind wiping fast-acting poison on his face. 
The poison, a VX nerve agent, has been classified by the United Nations as a weapon of mass destruction, Malaysian police said on Friday. 
After grabbing at his face the two women quickly walk away in different directions. 
Mr Kim, a heavy-set man in his 40s, died soon after the attack en route to hospital. 
The other woman, who is Vietnamese, was also arrested and has been questioned by Vietnamese officials. They have so far declined to comment. 
Malaysian police have said the two women had rehearsed the attack before carrying it out and had been instructed to wash their hands afterwards. 
One of the women is believed to have suffered from the effects of highly toxic poison and has been vomiting. Kim Jong Nam assassins 'used nerve agent VX to kill him' 
Malaysian authorities said they were looking for eight North Korean nationals in connection with Mr Kim’s murder, including a high-level North Korean diplomat and an employee of North Korea’s state-owned airline Air Koryo. 
On Saturday Malaysian authorities said they would issue an arrest warrant for Hyon Kwang Song, 44, a second secretary at the North Korean embassy in Kuala Lumpur, if he didn’t voluntarily cooperate with police. 
It was unclear if the embassy official can be detained since police have said he has diplomatic immunity. 
Malaysian police said they believed four of the eight North Koreans they were looking for, were already back in the North Korean capital Pyongyang. 
Those four are believed to have provided the women with the poison. More about:
